page.title: 10FARMING
page.content: {A Mixed Farm-New Common Farm-MARTON The farm covers 150 acres, but is on split sites.This is because the farmer has expanded his farm and purchased extra land (along with milk quotas) where it was available. Twenty acres each year is given over to growing potatoes, seventy-five acres is devoted to a grass crop and the rest is rough grazing for 145 dairy cattle. Potato growing is expensive as machinery and harvesting not to mention fertilizer,costs a great deal. Therefore, the acreage and production must be maintained to keep it economic The potatoes are graded and bagged at the farm and then sold in bulk to a co-operative. The largest crop on the farm is grass in the form of silage. The machinery for this is not expensive, but soil quality still needs to be high.
